text: Da Siena's altarpiece from 1291, an example of an early painted panel altarpiece, with the individual parts framed by gables and sculptured elements. Vigoroso da Siena was an Italian painter, known to be active 1270-1280. He was naturalized to Siena, Tuscany. A contemporary of Cimabue, his only documented work is a polyptych at the Galleria Nazionale of Perugia dated 1291.Luciano Bellosi, Enciclopedia dell' Arte Medievale (2000), Vigoroso da Siena on Treccani. ==References== Category:Year of birth unknown Category:Year of death unknown Category:13th-century Italian painters Category:Italian male painters Category:Sienese painters
